RainbruRPG::Options::OptionManager

RainbruRPG::Options::OptionManager Class Reference

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Provides an interface beetween plugins, launcher and game.

This singleton is used to add options that can be modified by the launcher option editor. The values are stored and loaded all the same way, so it is easy for a plugin to add a panel, button and/or new attribute.

It is organized in OptionPanel, OptionButton and OptionAttribute. This hierarchy provides a way to store a large number of options. The options are stored in a file called options.xml, loaded by xmlOptions.

The basic options of the core game are created by the Options class, using this manager. Take a look at its implementation if you want to create your own options.

RainbruRPG::Options::OptionPanel * RainbruRPG::Options::OptionManager::getPanelByName ( const char *  n  ) 

Returns a pointer to an existing OptionPanel.

Iterates through the OptionPanel list, if the name passed in parameter is used, return a pointer to this, otherwise, returns NULL.

This function uses std::strcmp.

Parameters:
n The caption of the panel to search
Returns:
A pointer to the existing panel or NULL if not found.
See also:
OptionPanel

Definition at line 92 of file optionmanager.cpp.

RainbruRPG::Options::OptionButton * RainbruRPG::Options::OptionManager::getButtonByName ( const char *  p,
const char *  b 
)

Returns a pointer to an existing OptionButton.

Iterates through the OptionPanel list, if the first name passed in parameter is used, we search in its button list for a button.

This function uses std::strcmp.

Parameters:
p The caption of the panel to search
b The caption of the button to search
Returns:
A pointer to the existing button or NULL if not found.
See also:
OptionPanel, OptionButton

Member Data Documentation

bool RainbruRPG::Options::OptionManager::damage [private]

Tells if the current snapshot is or not modified.

This value is modfied by the general callback of the LauncherOption's OptionAttribute s.
